definitions.title: n.[m.]
definitions.body: antimony, stibium (NH = BH; cf. poss. Ar. fak=a open, separate; Syr. pak pulverize; but [[פּוּךְ]] perh. foreign word);—black mineral powder, for increasing brilliance of eyes by darkening edges of lids; ´[[וַתָּשֶׂם בֵּפּ]] [[עֵינֶוהָ]] 2Ki 9:30, ´[[תִּקְרְעִי וגו]] Je 4:30; (on practice in Arab. v. We:GGN, 1893, 443; in Egypt, Lane:Mod. Egypt. ed. 5, i. 45 f.); fig. Is 54:11 of dark cement setting off precious stones (but We:DLZ, Aug. 2, 1890 Che:Hpt al. rd. [[נׁפֶח]] q.v.); ´[[אַבְנֵי פ]] 1Ch 29:2 are perh. stones of brilliant hue of antimony.—Cf. n.pr. [[קֶרֶן הַפּוּח]], and [[כָּחַל]]. p. 471, 902
